alert.note: Alert for South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 5:23AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Extremely dangerous and life threatening wind chills expected. Wind chills of 55 to 70 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Northern Laramie Range and lower elevations of Converse County including the city of Douglas. * WHEN...5 AM MST Wednesday until 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Wind chills of this magnitude can cause frostbite in less than 5 minutes if precautions are not taken. Hypothermia and death can also occur due to prolonged exposure to the cold. Livestock interests will be severely impacted.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. Dress in multiple, thick layers. Cover all exposed skin and wear a knit hat and mittens.
